briefdescription.para: Our configuration options.

Manages streams, cuBLAS handles and scratch memory for devices.

detaileddescription.para: Version that auto-constructs a flat coarse quantizer based on the desired metric

memberdef.argsstring: (GpuResourcesProvider *provider, Index *coarseQuantizer, int dims, faiss::MetricType metric, float metricArg, idx_t nlist, GpuIndexIVFConfig config=GpuIndexIVFConfig())
memberdef.name: GpuIndexIVF

detaileddescription.para: Version that takes a coarse quantizer instance. The GpuIndexIVF does not own the coarseQuantizer instance by default (functions like IndexIVF).

briefdescription.para: Copy what we need from the CPU equivalent.
Copy what we have to the CPU equivalent.

detaileddescription.para: Should be called if the user ever changes the state of the IVF coarse quantizer manually (e.g., substitutes a new instance or changes vectors in the coarse quantizer outside the scope of training)

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of inverted lists we're managing.
Returns the number of vectors present in a particular inverted list.

detaileddescription.para: Return the encoded vector data contained in a particular inverted list, for debugging purposes. If gpuFormat is true, the data is returned as it is encoded in the GPU-side representation. Otherwise, it is converted to the CPU format. compliant format, while the native GPU format may differ.
Return the vector indices contained in a particular inverted list, for debugging purposes.

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const float *x, idx_t k, const idx_t *assign, const float *centroid_dis, float *distances, idx_t *labels, bool store_pairs, const SearchParametersIVF *params=nullptr, IndexIVFStats *stats=nullptr) const override
memberdef.name: search_preassigned

detaileddescription.para: search a set of vectors, that are pre-quantized by the IVF quantizer. Fill in the corresponding heaps with the query results. The default implementation uses InvertedListScanners to do the search.

parameterdescription.para: coarse quantization indices, size nx * nprobe
distances to coarse centroids, size nx * nprobe
store inv list index + inv list offset instead in upper/lower 32 bit of result, instead of ids (used for reranking).
used to override the object's search parameters
search stats to be updated (can be null)

memberdef.name: range_search_preassigned

detaileddescription.para: Range search a set of vectors, that are pre-quantized by the IVF quantizer. Fill in the RangeSearchResults results. The default implementation uses InvertedListScanners to do the search.

parameterdescription.para: coarse quantization indices, size nx * nprobe
distances to coarse centroids, size nx * nprobe
store inv list index + inv list offset instead in upper/lower 32 bit of result, instead of ids (used for reranking).
used to override the object's search parameters
search stats to be updated (can be null)

memberdef.name: range_search

detaileddescription.para: query n vectors of dimension d to the index.
return all vectors with distance < radius. Note that many indexes do not implement the range_search (only the k-NN search is mandatory).

parameterdescription.para: input vectors to search, size n * d

briefdescription.para: removes all elements from the database.

detaileddescription.para: removes IDs from the index. Not supported by all indexes. Returns the number of elements removed.
Reconstruct a stored vector (or an approximation if lossy coding)

this function may not be defined for some indexes
key
id of the vector to reconstruct
recons
reconstucted vector (size d)
Reconstruct several stored vectors (or an approximation if lossy coding)

this function may not be defined for some indexes
n
number of vectors to reconstruct
keys
ids of the vectors to reconstruct (size n)
recons
reconstucted vector (size n * d)
Reconstruct vectors i0 to i0 + ni - 1

this function may not be defined for some indexes
i0
index of the first vector in the sequence
ni
number of vectors in the sequence
recons
reconstucted vector (size ni * d)
Get a DistanceComputer (defined in AuxIndexStructures) object for this kind of index.

detaileddescription.para: moves the entries from another dataset to self. On output, other is empty. add_id is added to all moved ids (for sequential ids, this would be this->ntotal)
check that the two indexes are compatible (ie, they are trained in the same way and have the same parameters). Otherwise throw.
Add vectors that are computed with the standalone codec

parameterdescription.para: codes to add size n * sa_code_size()

Copy what we have to the CPU equivalent.
vector dimension
total nb of indexed vectors
verbosity level

detaileddescription.para: set if the Index does not require training, or if training is done already

briefdescription.para: type of metric this index uses for search
argument of the metric type
number of probes at query time
max nb of codes to visit to do a query
quantizer that maps vectors to inverted lists
number of inverted lists

detaileddescription.para: = 0: use the quantizer as index in a kmeans training = 1: just pass on the training set to the train() of the quantizer = 2: kmeans training on a flat index + add the centroids to the quantizer

briefdescription.para: whether object owns the quantizer

detaileddescription.para: to override default clustering params

briefdescription.para: to override index used during clustering

detaileddescription.para: Base class of all GPU IVF index types. This (for now) deliberately does not inherit from IndexIVF, as many of the public data members and functionality in IndexIVF is not supported in the same manner on the GPU.
